snippet: Private equity’s use of carried interest to lower tax bills, though legal, has drawn criticism. But another lesser-known method might not withstand an I.R.S. challenge.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column observes that private equity’s use of carried interest to lower tax bills, though legal, has drawn criticism toward Mitt Romney; points out that another lesser-known method used by some firms, including Bain Capital, might not withstand an Internal Revenue Service challenge; notes it involves taxing management fees at lower capital gains rates.
lead_paragraph: Private equity’s use of carried interest to lower tax bills, though legal, has drawn criticism. But another lesser-known method might not withstand an I.R.S. challenge.

headline.print_headline: A Tax Tactic That’s Open To Question
headline.seo: A Private Equity Tax Tactic May Not Be Legal - High & Low Finance
headline.main: A Tax Tactic That’s Open to Question
